dirent $\ast$ \bf{gfal\_\-readdir} (DIR $\ast$)
\begin{CompactList}\small\item\em read a directory similar to the POSIX call readdir The readdir() function returns a pointer to a dirent structure representing the next directory entry in the directory stream pointed to by dirp. It returns NULL on reaching the end of the directory stream or if an error occurred. struct dirent \{ ino\_\-t d\_\-ino; // inode number off\_\-t d\_\-off; // offset to the next dirent unsigned short d\_\-reclen; // length of this record unsigned char d\_\-type; // type of file; not supported // by all file system types char d\_\-name[256]; // filename \}; \item\end{CompactList}\item

test access to the given file 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]path of the file to access, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em amode}]access mode to check (R\_\-OK, W\_\-OK, X\_\-OK or F\_\-OK) \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]This routine return 0 if the operation was successful, or -1 if error occured and errno is set, call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it. \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testchmod.c}.\end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}ssize\_\-t gfal\_\-getxattr (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, const char $\ast$ {\em name}, void $\ast$ {\em value}, size\_\-t {\em size})}\label{group__posix__group_gc793467bb55cd10d991ee1023b321dae}


retrieve an extended attribute value 

similar to the getxattr call of the libattr gfal\_\-getxattr retrieves an extended value for an url in a supported protocol. The extended attributes are use for the advanced file operations ( like set/get replicas, grid status, comments, etc... ) \begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: path of the file/dir, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em name,:}]name of the attribute to get \item[{\em value,:}]pointer to buffer to get the value \item[{\em size}]: size of the buffer \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return the size of the data returned, or -1 if error. In this case, errno is set and you can call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} for a more complete description. \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testget.c}.\end{Desc}
\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_listxattr@{gfal\_\-listxattr}}
\index{gfal_listxattr@{gfal\_\-listxattr}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}
\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}ssize\_\-t gfal\_\-listxattr (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, char $\ast$ {\em list}, size\_\-t {\em size})}\label{group__posix__group_gb3af1720532d8ad4798b08fa0868f4c7}


list all extended attributes 

similar to listxattr standard call of libattr gfal\_\-listxattr list all extended atributes associated with a file The extended attributes are use for the advanced file operations ( like set/get replicas, grid status, comments, etc... )

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: path of the file/dir, can be in a supported protocol (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em list,:}]a list of the attribute in a string format, on after each other, separated by '$\backslash$0'. \item[{\em size}]: size of the buffer \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return the size of the data in list , or -1 if error. In this case, errno is set and you can call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} for a more complete description. \end{Desc}
\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_lseek@{gfal\_\-lseek}}
\index{gfal_lseek@{gfal\_\-lseek}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}
\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}off\_\-t gfal\_\-lseek (int {\em fd}, off\_\-t {\em offset}, int {\em whence})}\label{group__posix__group_g8ba4e1df5f2e6439641c56f245d5ce73}


set position in a file 

similar to the POSIX call lseek gfal\_\-lseek positions/repositions to offset the file associated with the descriptor fd generated by a previous gfal\_\-open. whence indicates how to interpret the offset value:

SEEK\_\-SET The offset is set from beginning of file.

SEEK\_\-CUR The offset is added to current position.

SEEK\_\-END The offset is added to current file size. \begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em fd}]: file descriptor to lseek \item[{\em offset,:}]offset in byte \item[{\em whence,:}]flag \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]This routine returns the actual offset from the beginning of the file if the operation was successful or -1 if the operation failed. In the latter case, errno is set appropriately, you can call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} for a more complete description. \end{Desc}

\index{gfal_mkdir@{gfal\_\-mkdir}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}

\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_open@{gfal\_\-open}}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-open (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, int {\em flag},  {\em ...})}\label{group__posix__group_gedd0cf1c9158d27dd3a9c4413ca04cfa}


open a file similar to the POSIX call open opens a file according to the value of flags. 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: url of the filename to open. can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em flag}]: same flag supported value is built by OR\^{a}Äôing the bits defined in $<$fcntl.h$>$ but one and only one of the first three flags below must be used O\_\-RDONLY open for reading only O\_\-WRONLY open for writing only O\_\-RDWR open for reading and writing O\_\-CREAT If the file exists already and O\_\-EXCL is also set, gfal\_\-open will fail O\_\-LARGEFILE allows files whose sizes cannot be represented in 31 bits to be opened \item[{\em mode}]is used only if the file is created. \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return the file descriptor or -1 if errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testread.c}, and \bf{gfal\_\-testrw.c}.\end{Desc}
\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_opendir@{gfal\_\-opendir}}

\end{Desc}

\begin{Desc}

read a file similar to the POSIX call read gfal\_\-read reads up to size bytes from the file descriptor fd into the buffer pointed by buff 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em fd}]file descriptor \item[{\em buff}]buffer of the data to read \item[{\em s\_\-buff}]size of the data read in bytes \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]number of byte read or -1 if error, errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}struct dirent$\ast$ gfal\_\-readdir (DIR $\ast$ {\em d})}\label{group__posix__group_g2a8ed205f7748d7817a18521268a1f2d}


read a directory similar to the POSIX call readdir The readdir() function returns a pointer to a dirent structure representing the next directory entry in the directory stream pointed to by dirp. It returns NULL on reaching the end of the directory stream or if an error occurred. struct dirent \{ ino\_\-t d\_\-ino; // inode number off\_\-t d\_\-off; // offset to the next dirent unsigned short d\_\-reclen; // length of this record unsigned char d\_\-type; // type of file; not supported // by all file system types char d\_\-name[256]; // filename \}; 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em d}]file handle ( return by opendir ) to read \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]pointer to struct dirent with file information or NULL if end of list or error, errno is set call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Warning:]struct dirents are allocated statically, do not use free() on them \end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Examples: ]\par
\bf{gfal\_\-testdir.c}.\end{Desc}

\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-stat (const char $\ast$ {\em path}, struct stat $\ast$ {\em buff})}\label{group__posix__group_g1d8c86d522d5dd26ee7ddcd9c6925964}


informations about a file These functions return information about a file. No permissions are required on the file itself, but \^{a}Äî in the case of stat() and lstat() \^{a}Äî execute (search) permission is required on all of the directories in path that lead to the file. 

\begin{Desc}
\item[Parameters:]
\begin{description}
\item[{\em path}]: path of the file, can be in supported protocols (lfn, srm, file, guid,..) \item[{\em buff}]: pointer to an allocated struct stat \end{description}
\end{Desc}
\begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]return 0 if success else -1 and errno is set, call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} to check it \end{Desc}

\index{posix_group@{posix\_\-group}!gfal_unlink@{gfal\_\-unlink}}
\index{gfal_unlink@{gfal\_\-unlink}!posix_group@{posix\_\-group}}
\subsubsection{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int gfal\_\-unlink (const char $\ast$ {\em path})}\label{group__posix__group_gdeb4c6cc47f507da3e3b498374e308fb}


delete a name and possibly the file it refers to 

similar to the POSIX call unlink \doxyref{gfal\_\-unlink()}{p.}{group__posix__group_gdeb4c6cc47f507da3e3b498374e308fb} deletes a name from the file system. If that name was the last link to a file and no processes have the file open the file is deleted and the space it was using is made avail\^{a}Äê able for reuse.

If the name was the last link to a file but any processes still have the file open the file will remain in existence until the last file descriptor referring to it is closed.

If the name referred to a symbolic link the link is removed.

If the name referred to a socket, fifo or device the name for it is removed but processes which have the object open may continue to use it. \begin{Desc}
\item[Returns:]On success, zero is returned. On error, -1 is returned, and errno is set appropriately and you can call \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error()}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} for a more complete description. \end{Desc}
